summary: Trey Parker and Matt Stone accuse Paramount Global of interfering with negotiations that could net them billions of dollars . The parties were already in talks to find a new streaming home for the series in a deal worth as much as $2.5 billion . HBO Max, which held the rights, was interested . Several other companies, including Netflix, were interested .  Paramount had planned to split the US streaming rights to South Park between HBO Max and its own service, Paramount+. The HBO deal alone would have been worth more than $1 billion over 10 years, according to people with knowledge of the matter .  President Donald Trump's delay of the Paramount-Skydance deal has wreaked havoc at both companies . Employees at Paramount say the studio is paralyzed, unable to make major decisions at a time when the company is struggling . Paramount agreed to merge with Skydance last year in a deal that will shift control of the entertainment giant .  The younger Ellison plans to become Paramount’s CEO . He wants to delay the renewal of the deal until he gains long-awaited federal approval for the Paramount takeover . After 28 years and more than 300 episodes, South Park remains one of the most popular shows on streaming .  In 2007, Paramount secured a 50% stake in all future online deals for the show . In 2019, the company licensed the South Park streaming rights to HBO Max in a five-year deal valued at more than $500 million .  Skydance has pushed Paramount to sign a five-year deal with HBO Max . Selling to Netflix would save Paramount money, but it would also mean South Park is lost to Paramount+.  Skydance sees value in the show, but executives are concerned Paramount pays the creators too much . In 2021, Paramount struck an accord that called for the pair to keep making the show but also produce South Park movies that would stream on Paramount+. The deal was worth about $900 million .  The longer the two companies remain in limbo, the harder it becomes for either to make long-term plans . Ari Emanuel, one of Hollywood's most powerful talent agents, has been attempting to mediate between the two sides . Investors looking for stocks in the Broadcast Radio and Television sector might want to consider either Fox Corporation (FOX) or Netflix (NFLX) But which of these two stocks is more attractive to value investors? We'll need to take a closer look to find out .  Value investors tend to look at a number of traditional, tried-and-true figures to help them find stocks that they believe are undervalued at their current share price levels . The Style Score Value grade factors in a variety of key fundamental metrics, including the popular P/E ratio, P/S ratio, earnings yield and earnings yield .  FOX sticks out from NFLX in both our Zacks Rank and Style Scores models, so value investors will likely feel that FOX is the better option right now . NFLX has a P/B of 22.66 .

The Nasdaq 100 surged to a record high close, the first since February . The index is up 5.6% so far this year, while Invesco QQQQ is a proxy to the index .  Renewed AI enthusiasm among investors after a slowdown early in the year is driving tech stocks higher . The Federal Reserve kept its interest rate steady at 4.25-4.5%, signaling a continued "wait-and-see" stance . The central bank reaffirmed its outlook for two interest rate cuts before the end of the year .  QQQ provides exposure to the 101 largest domestic and international non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq . Information technology accounts for 57.2% of the assets, while consumer discretionary makes up for a 19.7% share . The Consumer Price Index rose just 0.1% year over year in May, putting inflation at 2.4% .  Palantir Technologies has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) and a Growth Score of A . Zscaler is one of the world’s leading providers of cloud-based security solutions . The company saw a solid earnings estimate revision of 12 cents over the past 30 days .  Micron Technology has an estimated earnings growth rate of 433.1% for the fiscal year (ending August 2025) MercadoLibre is one of the largest e-commerce platforms in Latin America . Netflix is considered a pioneer in the streaming space .  Netflix is a dominant streaming service provider, courtesy of its wide-ranging content portfolio and a fortified international footprint . The stock gained 43.5% so far this year and has an estimated growth of 27.7% . Netflix currently has a Zacks Rank #3 and a Growth Score of A .

Pivotal Research analyst Jeffrey Wlodarczak recently reiterated a "Buy" rating and lifted his price target to a Street-high $1,600 . Wall Street is doubling down, with PIVotal Research's view of Netflix as “underpenetrated globally,” with strong growth ahead .  Netflix has already put on a show this year, jumping 43% year-to-date . Around 25% upside remains if NFLX stock can hit Pivotal's mark . Founded in 1997, Netflix evolved from DVD rentals to an international streaming behemoth .  Netflix shares have rallied more than 200% in just two years, with a 91% jump in the past 52 weeks alone . Netflix reached an all-time high of $1,282.57 on June 24 . With bold bets on content, ad-supported streaming, live events, and even gaming, Netflix is building a fortress .  Netflix reported revenue of $10.5 billion, up 12% year-over-year (YOY) EPS surged 25% to $6.61, crushing estimates by more than 16% . Operating margins widened to an impressive 32%, a clear sign Netflix knows how to scale without losing control of its costs . Price hikes landed well, boosting revenue without denting satisfaction .  Netflix is gearing up to drop Q2 earnings on July 17 . Co-CEO Greg Peters called business conditions stable, adding that entertainment has historically shown resilience in economic downturns . Netflix anticipates a clear runway for growth in 2025 .  Pivotal’s Jeff Wlodarczak sees Netflix's brand and content library as global moats — sticky, valuable, and tough to replicate . The ad-supported tier is not just smart but profitable, boosting ARPU without losing .  Wall Street is leaning bullish on NFLX stock, but with a cautious foot on the brake and a consensus “Moderate Buy” rating . Of the 45 analysts rating the stock, 28 analysts recommend a “Strong Buy’s” recommendation, three suggest a Moderate Buy, and the remaining 14 analysts give a Hold’ rating . NFLX currently trades above the mean price target of $1,196.17 .

Netflix stock has significantly outperformed the market this year as investors remain bullish . The business continues to grow revenue by double digits, with impressive profitability . Shares trade at a steep P/E ratio, which could entice some investors to take profits .  Netflix brought in $10.5 billion in revenue in the first quarter . As of year-end 2024, it had 302 million subscribers . According to data from Nielsen, 7.5% of all daily TV viewing time in the U.S. went to Netflix . Investors should buy this stock today if they believe Netflix will keep generating strong financial results .  If you have conviction that the business will continue to perform well over the next five years and beyond, there is no reason to sell Netflix stock . The same reasoning applies to existing shareholders, particularly those sitting on huge gains thanks to their Netflix positions .  Netflix trades at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 58.2 right now . That's a 147% premium to the S&P 500 index . Unsurprisingly, I personally would not be a buyer of Netflix stock at the current valuation .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Netflix House is a new venture into physical immersive entertainment venues . Each Netflix House will span over 100,000 square feet and serve as a permanent, year-round destination for fans to step directly into the worlds of their favorite shows and films . The first two Netflix House locations are scheduled to open in late 2025 in Philadelphia and Dallas .  The Dallas location at Galleria Dallas will host immersive experiences based on ‘Stranger Things: Escape the Dark, and ‘Squid Game: Survive the Trials.” A home theater with family members enjoying streaming content together.
